debutant.description: Take turns with a coach or practice partner to hone forehand and backhand loops.

intermediaire.description: Serve backspin, partner pushes it back long, and you practice looping. Play out the point. Start with first loop to same spot each time.

intermediaire.nom: Variations of Serve and Loop Drills
intermediaire.description: Partner pushes to one spot, you forehand or backhand loop, then play out the point. Or partner pushes to wide forehand/middle and you forehand/backhand loop.
Partner pushes randomly, sometimes aiming one way and then going the other direction, quick off the bounce. You react with forehand or backhand loop.

avance.description: Partner pushes anywhere randomly, you react with forehand or backhand loop. Sometimes aiming one way and then going the other direction, quick off the bounce.

exercices_complementaires.description: Do the same drills as Serve and Loop Drills, but play games that start out in these ways. Keep score to make it resemble real game situations.

erreurs_a_eviter.description: Practicing topspin rallies over and over, but not against backspin.
Looping at different speeds or to different spots each time.
